basics.name: Lance Arlington Taylor
basics.label: Multifaceted Telecommunications Professional
basics.summary: A Dynamic Telecommunications Leader & Innovator with a deep command of RF Engineering, Data Analytics, and Development. Recognized for transforming Canadian telco standards through strategic foresight and hands-on expertise. Exceptional at demystifying complex topics for actionable decision-making. Awarded for innovation, I combine empathy and a detail-oriented approach, ready to lead and elevate the future of telecommunications.

work.position: Senior Engineering Manager, National Fibre Network Planning
work.summary: Strategic Planning & Communication, Interdepartmental Collaboration, Operational Efficiency & Innovation, Broadband Subsidy Success
highlights: Devised and presented a transformative 3-year FTTH rollout plan for 2.6 million homes, garnering praise for enhanced clarity and insight in strategy communication to CEO and EVP levels.
Worked seamlessly with product and sales teams, integrating competitive market strategies and key customer needs into the fiber rollout.
Established a dedicated KPI-tracking team, harnessing big-data technologies to optimize reporting, slashing redundancy, and achieving a 30% faster turnaround.

Directed planning and design for subsidy program bids, surpassing targets using a complex heuristic model and ensuring the successful implementation of a multi-gig FTTH program across diverse regions.

work.position: Senior Engineering Manager, National Wireless Network Planning
work.summary: Strategic Team Building, Executive Alignment, 5G Mastery, Spectrum Stewardship, Auction Analytics, AI-Driven Predictions, Competitive Vigilance, GIS Leadership, Global Innovations Partnership, Client Diplomacy, People Development & Training
highlights: Constructed and directed an elite engineering unit focused on the progressive evolution of spectrum-asset-based wireless networks from UMTS to 5G. Recruited top talent and transformed processes to exceed targets and improve employee engagement.

Regularly engaged with CEO and EVP tiers, presenting strategic blueprints ensuring synchronization with overarching corporate goals. Received continued praise for distilling exceptional clarity on complex, financially impacting, technical topics.

Seamlessly executed both fixed and mobile 5G NR launches. Delved deep into technical evaluations, capital investments, vendor selections, and nuanced strategies for effective indoor 5G deployments tailored to varied businesses.
Orchestrated meticulous management of spectrum assets in adherence to ISED guidelines, outperforming expectations and pioneering deployments in non-native territories.

Became an instrumental force in multiple spectrum auctions by providing in-depth data analytics encompassing network performance, population coverage scenarios and valuation, and strategic market prioritization.

Nurtured emerging talents, guiding them towards the creation of a machine-learning model for accurate traffic forecasting, yielding impressive accuracy improvements resulting in millions of cost avoidance

Instituted a dedicated team focused on competitor insights, gaining an edge by accurately preempting competitor 5G spectrum deployments and feature rollouts, and identifying weak network areas for investment prioritization

Managed the entire Wireless GIS and Statistics teams, initiated a revamp of core GIS systems, and met the dynamic needs of cross-functional teams. Reduced network coverage map refresh times to <10% of their previous length

Represented Bell in international forums, particularly in Korea, driving discussions on 5G breakthroughs and standing as the prime network representative during the launch of Canada's first 5G mobile product (TSN 5G View).
Forged bonds with private enterprises and governmental bodies on network enhancements, offering authoritative guidance and showcasing the network's prowess in pivotal negotiations.
Crafted and disseminated corporate 5G NR training modules to an audience of 6,000+ employees, gaining accolades and repurposing content for nationwide sales demonstrations.

work.position: Senior Engineering Manager, National Network Performance
work.summary: Strategic Leadership: Spearheaded a team of over 20 technical experts, solidifying Canada's position with the Best and Fastest Mobile Network title, covering a vast technical spectrum from IP backbone to RAN to mobile devices.
highlights: Operational Revamp: Orchestrated an agile transformation, segmenting teams into specialized e2e wireless feature development units. Utilized scrum methodologies to strike a balance between innovation and operational excellence.
Benchmarking Excellence: Clinched the 'Best Network' accolade from GWS in 2017 both at national and regional levels.
Innovative Network Strategies: Elevated Bell's stature on the global stage with the world's fastest LTE 4CCA network deployment.
Feature Development Mastery: Steered the exemplary VoLTE service launch, setting new industry benchmarks.
Pioneering Optimization: Championed the inception of a self-regulating network platform.

work.position: Senior Engineering Manager, Regional RF Engineering & Network Performance
work.summary: Empowering People: Managed 12 novice and senior RF Engineers; directed RF design across Greater Ontario with a $200M annual budget.
highlights: Operational Delivery: Executed major telecom projects, including 3500MHz, 2600MHz and 700MHz spectrum deployments.
New Technology Introduction: Drove wireless access strategy for Greater Ontario and executed a $50M project for Wireless Home Internet.
Conflict Management: Successfully managed Canada-US border optimization of LTE frequencies.
Team Player: Collaborated with construction, real-estate, and field teams for optimized deployment and maximum ROI.

work.position: RF Engineering Specialist: NS, NB, PEI
work.summary: Orchestrated RF design across NB, NS, and PEI, launching 20+ macro cell towers and delivering 200+ optimization and spectrum additional projects.
highlights: Delivered first Atlantic small cell cluster in Charlottetown, PEI, pioneering relations with utility and infrastructure providers.
Regional prime with significant role in launching LTE 2100 MHz in Halifax, Nova Scotia.

honors: Vice President Communications, DSEUS Engineering Society
Sobey's School of Business Small Business Award

awards.summary: Recognized for exceptional leadership and contributions to the company's strategic goals.
